cip.render.raytrace.geometry

Class Ellipsoid

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AGeometry
      • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AQuadricGeo
        • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.Sphere
          • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.Ellipsoid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtGeometry

    public class Ellipsoid
extends Sphere
    This is the implementation of an ellipsoid of some radii centered at 0,0,0 in the object coordinate system.

    The ellipsoid is specified as a node in an XML file as: 

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.Ellipsoid" name="ellipsoidName">
         <radius>radius</radius>
         <radius>Xradius,Yradius,Zradius</radius>
         <MaterialByRef name="materialName"/>
         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="materialClass">
               .
             material specific nodes and attributes
               .
         </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
         <face plane="A,B,C,D"/>
           .
           .
         <face plane="A,B,C,D">
           <MaterialByRef>materialName</MaterialByRef>
           <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="materialClass">
                 .
               material specific nodes and attributes
                 .
           </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
         </face>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    where:
    radius The radii of the ellipsoid. This is specified either as a single value which is applied to i, j, and k resulting in a sphere (the degenerate case of the ellipsoid); or as 3 values that will be applied as X radius, Y radius, and Z radius individually. The default is a ellipsoid with X, Y, and Z radii of 1.0, 2.0, and 3.0 if not specified.
    MaterialByRef The specification for a material for the ellipsoid. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.
    DynamicallyLoadedObject The specification for a material for the ellipsoid. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.
    face Optional, none for a true sphere. The plane equation of a clipping face. There are as many face entries as there are clipping planes on the ellipsoid. The plane equation is normalized during object load. Within the face description these elements may optionally appear:
    • MaterialByRef - A material for the face specified by reference to the name of a previously loaded material. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material.
    • DynamicallyLoadedObject - The specification for a material for the face. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface.
    If no face material is specified, the ellipsoid material is used. Face materials are best used with opaque objects. Specifying different transparent materials for the ellipsoid and clipping faces should be avoided unless the materials are the same except for surface roughness, i.e. smooth glass and frosted (sandblasted) glass.

    Example of XML Specification

    The following specifies a sphere of radii 5, 3, and 2:

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.Ellipsoid" name="ellipsoid">
         <radius>5,3,2</radius>
         <MaterialByRef name="blue"/>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    Since:
    1.0

      • pkgParseElement

        boolean pkgParseElement(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                        java.util.LinkedList<INamedObject> refObjectList)
                 throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        This method is called for every element in the XML description that is not a material specification for the object (common to all geometries and parsed by this abstract class)
        Overrides:
        pkgParseElement in class Sphere
        Parameters:
        element - (not null, readonly) The dom element to be parsed.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Returns:
        true if the element was parsed, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there is an error in the scene description XML that cannot be parsed by this object.

      • pkgToXml

        protected void pkgToXml(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        Override this function to add object-specific information to an XML node.
        Overrides:
        pkgToXml in class Sphere
        Parameters:
        element - The dynamically loaded object node that the object-specific information should be written into. The IDynXmlObject.loadFromXml(Element, LinkedList) funtcion must be overridden by the geometry implementation to be able to read the object-specific information set by the object here.
